it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket

Class Ip4Socket

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket.Socket
      • it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket.Ip4Socket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PaddedIpSocket

    public class Ip4Socket
extends Socket
    It implements an IPv4 socket for sending and receiving IPv4 packets.

    An Ip4Socket is always associated to a protocol number (i.e. the 'IP_PROTO' header field).

    • Field Detail

      • RECV_BUFFER_SIZE

        public static int RECV_BUFFER_SIZE
        Maximum receiver buffer size

      • IP_TOS

        public static final int IP_TOS
        IPv4 Socket option: IP type of service (TOS); to be used with getsockopt() and setsockopt() methods. It is a byte and it is used to prioritize packets on the network.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IP_TTL

        public static final int IP_TTL
        IPv4 Socket option: IP time to live (TTL); to be used with getsockopt() and setsockopt() methods. Argument is an integer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IP_HDRINCL

        public static final int IP_HDRINCL
        IPv4 Socket option: Header is included with data; to be used with getsockopt() and setsockopt() methods. If enabled, the user supplies an IP header in front of the user data. When it is enabled the values set by IP_OPTIONS, IP_TTL and IP_TOS are ignored.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IP_OPTIONS

        public static final int IP_OPTIONS
        IPv4 Socket option: IP options; to be used with getsockopt() and setsockopt() methods. The option arguments are a pointer to a memory buffer containing the options and the option length. The maximum option size for IPv4 is 40 bytes. See RFC 791 for the allowed options.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • receive

        public Ip4Packet receive()
        Receives an IP packet.

        This method is blocking, that is it returns only when a packet is received.

        Returns:
        the received IP packet

      • receive

        public void receive(Ip4Packet packet)
        Receives an IP packet.

        This method is blocking, that is it returns only when a packet is received.

        Parameters:
